Measure Description: Difference between the number of mainstream financial services and alternative financial services.
Number of off-premises (purchases intended to be consumed off-site) alcohol outlets per 10,000 people.
Percent of individuals below 100% of the federal poverty level.
Percent of households with a computer and access to broadband internet.

Percent of households experiencing housing stress, as defined by meeting one or more of the following conditions: (1) housing expense/income threshold: monthly housing costs, including utilities, exceed 30% of income, (2) crowding: more household members than rooms, (3) incomplete plumbing: home lacks necessary bathroom facilities, and (4) incomplete kitchen: home lacks essential kitchen facilities.

Measure: Living Within a Half-Mile of a Park
Measure Description: Percent of the population that lives within a half-mile of a park.
Difference in percent of mortgage applications accepted between all applicants and minority applicants.
Percent of population age 25 or older without a high school diploma or equivalent.
Percent of children enrolled in nursery school or pre-school.
Estimated incidence of police killings per 100,000 people.

The Index of Concentration at the Extremes (ICE) is measure of economic and racial/ethnic spatial polarization and proxy for residential segregation, defined as the absolute difference between the percent of the total population that is high-income and majority versus low-income and minority in a population.
Number of third places, defined as places where people spend time outside of their home (“first place”) and their work (“second place”), per 100,000 people.
Percent of labor force that is unemployed.
Number of violent crimes reported per 100,000 people.

Source: ACS/DEC/MIT Election Data Science Lab/NYT/United States Election Data Project
Measure Description: Percent of individuals who voted in the 2020 election.
Spatial accessibility of mental health treatment facilities, weighted by the range of facility offerings available.
Spatial accessibility of substance use treatment facilities, weighted by the range of facility offerings available.
Percent of the civilian non-institutionalized population without health insurance.
Percent of adults reporting binge drinking in the past 30 days (calculated as a crude prevalence).
Number of alcohol related deaths per 100,000 people.
Number of deaths per 100,000 people related to drug poisoning.
Percent of adults reporting sleeping less than 7 hours on average (calculated as a crude prevalence).
Estimate of life expectancy at birth, in years.
Percent of adults who have a body mass index ≥30.0 kg/m² (calculated from self-reported weight and height as a crude prevalence).
Percent of adults reporting 14 or more days of poor mental health in the past 30 days (calculated as a crude prevalence).
Percent of adults that currently smoke cigarettes (calculated as a crude prevalence).
Percent of the adult population over the age of 18 that experienced serious thoughts of suicide in the last past year.
Number of deaths attributed to suicide per 100,000 people.
